description: Ethiopia demands the media to play a focused and critical role in raising prevention awareness at all levels, from March 23.
On March 27, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute started releasing daily notification notes to disseminate reliable information about COVID-19 to the public.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: From April 11, Ethiopia obliges any individual to report a suspected case of Covid-19.

description: From April 11, Ethiopia has installed a centralised communication system to inform the public on the pandemic.

compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: From April 13, the Ethiopian Community Radio Network, in cooperation with the Ministry of Health, the UN Communication Group, ethiotelecom, and other partners, supported by UNESCO, established a digital information-sharing platform that facilitates instant information access on COVID-19 for community radio journalists and volunteers.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 2, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute published a protocol on infection prevention and control for COVID-19 outlining necessary measures to guide leaders and managers at all levels, health professionals, other support staff and relevant stakeholders. The policy is implied to have been in place since April 2020.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 30, Ethiopia launched a mobile application to share uniform information among medical staff members following COVID 19 patients in same facilities.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On May 30, Ethiopia launched a COVID-19 mobile application to track people and alert them if they have been in close contact with an infected person.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On June 2, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute published standard operating procedures for the use of masks and gloves to limit the spread of COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 2, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute published a guide for the rational use of personal protective equipment in the response to COVID-19 in the healthcare sector and the community.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 11, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute released an official guide with self-care tips on maintaining mental health and psycho-social wellbeing during the COVID-19 pandemic for health care professionals.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 11, the Ethiopian Public Health Institute published guidelines on Mental Health and Psycho-social services for people in quarantine and isolation centres in the response to COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 10, Ethiopia commended the use of Dexamethasone for COVID-19 patients who require oxygen and mechanical ventilation for treatment.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 26, the Ethiopian Hygiene & Behaviour Change Coalition (HBCC) partners launched a project to run a mass media campaign and to enable hygiene measures at critical locations.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 29, Ethiopia announced the launching of a survey on serologic evidence of the SARS-COV-2 infection in selected high-risk groups and sampled population, based on the WHO generic population sero-epidemiological investigation protocol, and is expected to inform public health responses and policy decisions.
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On July 23, the Addis Ababa administration introduced a new COVID-19 prevention project for a duration of 6 months under the name "Our Health is in Our Hands" that aims to protect more than 1.2 million people in the capital. . The project will distribute sanitation and hygienic supplies to the residents based on family sizes and aims to undertake awareness creation activities among the community on ways of combating the pandemic.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On July 30, the Prime Minister of Ethiopia raised awareness on respecting the COVID-19 restrictions as a religious duty in his greetings address on the Muslim celebration of Eid-al-Adha.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On August 14, Ethiopia officially launched the Covid-19 ComBAT campaign which promotes nationwide community mobilisation with testing, screening, surveillance, and public awareness through active public participation.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On August 14, Ethiopia's President Sahle-Work Zewde launched the MaskEthiopia Campaign in order to promote the proper wearing of masks to protect communities.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: From February 7, Ethiopia enforces a quarantine on all passengers, including Ethiopian nationals, arriving from Wuhan, China.

description: Ethiopia is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers, including Ethiopian nationals in designated hotels at their own personal cost from March 20, extended under the State of Emergency from April 11. Passengers that cannot afford to cover their expense will be supported by the government.

description: Ethiopia is enforcing a 15-day mandatory quarantine in Addis Ababa Science and Technology University (ASTU) for passengers who cannot afford to be quarantined in designated hotels, from March 27.

description: From June 19, Ethiopia is mandating passengers from abroad who hold a COVID-19 negative certificate done up to 72 hours before arrival to do a 14-day self-quarantine at home after giving sample upon arrival.

description: From June 19, Ethiopia is demanding individuals suspected of COVID-19 or who tested positive with mild or no symptoms to self-isolate at home, if they have the resources and the support. If they do not meet the self-isolation criteria, they will  be isolated in non-clinical facilities.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: From June 19, Ethiopia is enforcing a seven-day mandatory quarantine for arrivals from abroad, reduced from 14 days. The measure is part of the State of Emergency rulings and therefore expires for the latest on September 8, 2020.

description: From June 19, Ethiopia is enforcing a seven-day mandatory quarantine in government facilities for travellers with no certificate of negative testing on COVID-19, followed by a seven-day self-quarantine at home. The measure is part of the State of Emergency rulings and therefore expires for the latest on September 8, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

As of September 23, Ethiopia lifted COVID-19 restrictions imposed on the tourism/travel industry. The House of People's Representatives allowed the sector to re-open while respecting the precautionary measures of the Ministry of Health.

description: Om March 16, Ethiopia announces a restriction on large gatherings.

Ethiopia is tasking the security sector to enforce restrictions on large gatherings and to maintain social distancing.

On June 10, Ethiopia postponed the fourth national housing and population census due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The census is postponed to taking place within two years after confirmation by relevant bodies that the pandemic will no longer cause damages to public health.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: From June 19, Ethiopia is allowing burial arrangements of all deaths at home or health facilities to be held by the family at a preferred burial ground, with attendees of no more than 50 people. The policy is exempt from the restriction on mass gatherings of up to 4 people, which remains in place.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)

description: On August 1st, the Ethiopian House of Federation (HoF) urged the Tigray regional state to immediately stop its move to hold an election, deemed unconstitutional. After the National Electoral Board of Ethiopia (NEBE) had postponed the 6th national election due to COVID-19, to be held on August 29, the HoF emphasised Tigray's move to be therefore unconstitutional.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: On August 14, the Ethiopian regional state of Tigray granted amnesty for 1,568 prisoners amid the Covid-19 pandemic in order to contain the spread of the virus in the region.

description: As of September 23, Ethiopia allowed sporting events to take place again in accordance with the COVID-19 precautionary measures recommended by the Ministry of Health.

description: On September 18, Ethiopia announced that the Meskel Demera religious festival, scheduled for September 26, will be allowed to take place with a limited number of attendees.
